meanings.definition: a pilot who supports another in a potentially dangerous flying situation
meanings.sent1: The wingman flew beside the lead pilot to provide support during the mission.
meanings.sent2: The experienced pilot acted as a wingman for the new recruit during the training exercise.
meanings.sent3: The wingman joked, 'I've got your back, just don't forget to check your fuel tank!'
meanings.sent4: In the sky, the wingman was like a guardian angel, always ready to swoop in and assist.
meanings.sent5: The role of a wingman is crucial in ensuring the safety of all pilots involved.

meanings.definition: a person who helps or supports another in a social situation, especially in attracting potential romantic partners
meanings.sent1: At the party, my friend was the best wingman, introducing me to everyone.
meanings.sent2: She asked her sister to be her wingman at the speed dating event.
meanings.sent3: The wingman slyly whispered, 'I'll make sure you don't end up dancing alone tonight.'
meanings.sent4: With his charming smile, he played the role of a wingman, helping his friend make a connection.
meanings.sent5: Having a reliable wingman can make navigating the social scene much easier.
